text: have you ever had that annoying thing
where maybe you're stressed out or
you're angry and the corner of your eye
starts to flicker or
twitch that's called blepharospasm it is
very common most people if they have a
mild type of blepharospasm really don't
need treatment it'll come and go it's
just it's something you live with stress
will bring on that kind of twitching
there are many methods for relaxing and
whether that is you know breathing
slowly or relaxing the muscles in your
body or meditating any of those may be
helpful in reducing stress and reducing
the frequency with which you get those
twitches at the edge of your eyes
some people have it really bad they can
involve half the face and the treatment
for that believe it or not is Botox
Botox is not only for cosmetic uses
there are several medical uses for for
Botox and treating severe blepharospasm
is is wonderful
